creditline: Lent by the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: dark brown and white musk cat; body is facing L and its head is turned to the R; bird in a tree branch at ULC
text: The musk cat is not native to Japan. Nevertheless, the Japanese knew the animal as early as the Kamakura period (1185-1333) through imported Chinese paintings by such Southern Song masters as Mao I. Pictures of musk cats often ornamented rooms used for poetry readings and tea parties in the castles of warlords.
title: Musk Cat
